alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 17 at 11:24AM EST until November 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Bay County and St. Joseph Peninsula State Park Beaches. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Based on coordination with area beach officials, red flags are flying at Bay County beaches as well as at St. Joseph Peninsula State Park beaches. The rip current risk should begin decreasing late this afternoon as winds and surf relax.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
